data.text: Being together has made us wealthier: over the last two decades, the euro area has become one of the strongest economies in the world. In terms of GDP per person, it ranks second among the world’s leading economies. Read our explainer to find out more https://t.co/jIPhlWZqSL https://t.co/2v2MV56FGo
@BitcoinRat Or try this one instead https://t.co/dnnLW6IKjs
@BitcoinRat Sorry you couldn’t access the page. Try again with this link https://t.co/kbcISXl6FD
Euro area monthly balance of payments (Nov 2018) https://t.co/kbcISXl6FD

Sabine Lautenschläger: Another challenge is technology: it may change the ways in which supervisors do their jobs, and re-shape supervisory priorities. Digitalisation comes with risks and we, as supervisors, must be as cautious as we would expect banks to be in that regard. 3/3

Sabine Lautenschläger: European banking supervisors have worked hard to prepare for Brexit. But whatever we do must be rooted in the existing regulatory framework. And that framework is still fragmented, which is problematic when supervising globally active banks. 2/3

What does the future hold for European banking supervision? At today’s Annual Risk Management & Supervisory Conference, Supervisory Board Vice-Chair Sabine Lautenschläger discusses the upcoming challenges. Read on to find out more https://t.co/RWujg2ThoP 1/3 https://t.co/JFr5wrJMog

Over a third of the money moved around the globe in 2017 was in euros. This is because the euro is the second most commonly used currency for international transactions, borrowing and lending and central bank reserves. Find out more https://t.co/wkff0Jtws7 #EUROat20 https://t.co/vMtoUoIbTP
Interview Sabine Lautenschläger with Politico https://t.co/Of0urcPeVA
For more details click here: https://t.co/7jh3v1ME6D
What’s the split between men and women? https://t.co/4fGzYQIfdW
How many of them are over 55? https://t.co/VKn3IvLAv3
What percentage of these 9.6 million people have completed higher education? https://t.co/xOc9qowBGs
How many more people are in a job in the eurozone now than in 2013? https://t.co/XYVn2l5g2c
How many people are employed in the eurozone right now? https://t.co/sjsPL5l82q

(THREAD) Employment is at a record high in the eurozone, according to a piece in our latest Economic Bulletin, which reports on employment since the economic recovery began in 2013. Here are some of the stats...
Letter ECB President to Mr Stelios Kouloglou, MEP, on the Greek adjustment programme https://t.co/GGhz22ErJ8 (EN) https://t.co/ETGtsSzaz5 (EL)
Watch the remarks of President Mario Draghi and his predecessor Jean-Claude Trichet at yesterday’s @Europarl_EN session to mark the 20th anniversary of the euro #EUROat20 https://t.co/1Y623G6kE3
Working paper: CoMap - Mapping contagion in the euro area banking sector https://t.co/B39uteAhV9
Working paper: Leaning against the wind - Macroprudential policy and the financial cycle https://t.co/Jx5yMACxfp

The ECB has published a single Code of Conduct for all its decision-makers and high-level officials. It is the latest measure taken by the ECB to further strengthen and refine its good governance frameworks. Find out more https://t.co/Ix5r66o1KI
Interview Yves Mersch with Hospodarske noviny https://t.co/TaUdbYS0mX (EN) https://t.co/HNvTanPgX5 (SK)

Draghi: Great progress has been achieved since the crisis struck, but more work still needs to be done; and there is no alternative to a future where we will continue to work together to make our Economic and Monetary Union an even stronger engine of prosperity. #EUROat20 5/5

Draghi: Stable prices have fostered people’s confidence in the value of their savings, which is one of the conditions for prosperity. Based on such confidence, firms invest and create new jobs. #EUROat20 4/5

Draghi: The euro has safeguarded the integrity of the Single Market. Today, our economies are integrated to a point that was not imaginable when the euro was designed. Intra-EU exports have risen from 13% of EU GDP in 1992 to 20% today. #EUROat20 3/5

(THREAD) Mario Draghi spoke today at the European Parliament’s plenary session on the 20th anniversary of the euro. Read the full speech here https://t.co/58LI6SVDIz #EUROat20 1/5 https://t.co/iE67ERBGkQ
Working paper: On the retirement effect of inheritance - Heterogeneity and the role of risk aversion https://t.co/f4LTGyN0FN
Working paper: Interest rates and foreign spillovers https://t.co/tENC3Vo83R
ECB publishes first statistics on secured euro money market https://t.co/k6iDd3itJc

Working paper: Attenuating the forward guidance puzzle - Implications for optimal monetary policy https://t.co/A3KqqZZFUv
Euro area securities issues statistics (Nov 2018) https://t.co/hTozSPdWcj

Research shows that joining the euro alone contributed to a 12% increase in Slovakia’s exports, and helped to strengthen its institutions, says Yves Mersch. Find out more about the euro’s benefits in our explainer https://t.co/qDX9gUH2uj 4/4

Yves Mersch: The Slovak economy has built strong ties to the Single Market, outperforming its central and eastern European neighbours in the euro area. Its export share is almost 100% of GDP, while nearly 20% of Slovak jobs depend on EU exports 2/4 https://t.co/2X9EyTmMB7

[THREAD]  Executive Board member Yves Mersch spoke today about Slovakia’s economic success since joining the euro area 10 years ago. Read on to find out more and take a look at the full speech https://t.co/ZngzlL5l9s 1/4  #EUROat20 https://t.co/FAdsODBaSA
Account of the monetary policy meeting of the Governing Council of the ECB on 12-13 December 2018 https://t.co/gba1pgU7TQ
Interview Luis de Guindos with Latvian TV1   https://t.co/YfKvoFz7vD
ECB publishes consolidated Guide to assessments of licence applications https://t.co/ZyaHeEavBL
@nickcoatesnes See https://t.co/XLlf9l24Oz, page 31.

Which ESTER-based methodology would be best suited for producing a fallback rate for EURIBOR-linked contracts? Share your views with the working group on euro risk-free rates by 1 February https://t.co/kA5f6Zl5kt https://t.co/2eUykaIuaA

ESTER, the new euro short-term rate, is coming later this year and will replace EONIA. What is the best way for markets to make the transition? Read the report by the working group on euro risk-free rates and share your comments by 1 February https://t.co/9yl6vMS68i https://t.co/xatr1yXIhk

Interview Ignazio Angeloni with Il Sole 24 Ore https://t.co/FYIOgGRjyC (EN) https://t.co/eiCySlmCPn (IT)
Entretien de Benoît Cœuré avec France Inter: https://t.co/AjzqFG4o6h

Popular support for the euro is strong and growing. Three-quarters of EU citizens in the euro area are now in favour of our single currency, the highest level since 2004. Here at the ECB we ensure that the euro remains stable so you can fully enjoy its benefits. #EUROat20 https://t.co/8kD1FCDdNF
Monetary developments in the euro area (Nov 2018) https://t.co/UlujZRQM2Y
Apsveicam jubilejā! Happy anniversary! 🇱🇻🇪🇺 https://t.co/RzL464gaWq

Andrea Enria chats with colleagues over a cup of tea. As an Italian, he of course appreciates a good espresso, but after years working in London as the Chairperson of the European Banking Authority he likes to have a cup of tea in the morning 4/4 https://t.co/xX47XGiNDy

Andrea Enria gets to know new colleagues in the staff cafeteria. Mr Enria is no stranger to the ECB and remembers the staff cafeteria from when he used to work in the financial supervision division more than 15 years ago 3/4 https://t.co/KOVFD5FfDQ

Andrea Enria is settling into his new job and getting straight to work. Here he is at a meeting with colleagues, discussing his agenda for the next weeks. He will work closely with around a thousand supervisors during his five-year term at the ECB 2/4 https://t.co/yzjUuAD5lU

[THREAD] Welcome, Andrea Enria! The new Chair of the ECB Supervisory Board has started his first day of work at the Eurotower in Frankfurt, the headquarters of ECB Banking Supervision. Follow this thread to see how his first hour at work went 1/4 https://t.co/JNFl3Z6bDX

The euro has come a long way since Economic and Monetary Union was first discussed in the late 1960s. Take a moment to think about the benefits that the single currency has brought us – read our explainer https://t.co/9jtPVUFzEh #EUROat20 https://t.co/a385TgjpsW

The launch of the euro on 1 January 1999 was part of the preparations for a Single Market driven by the desire to remove barriers, boost economic potential and bring more people back into work. Read what President Draghi said last month about the #EUROat20 https://t.co/eAUJ2MShDx https://t.co/DK8gmA0pLk
Read the statement from the five Presidents of the EU institutions that contributed to the journey of the euro, which turns 20 today! #EUROat20 https://t.co/ftdbUpXtts
Interview Sabine Lautenschläger with Deutschlandfunk https://t.co/ETVhyV7l4e (EN) https://t.co/2IPv2oTMDG (DE)

ECB colleagues recently said their farewells to Ms Nouy. We join them in paying tribute to her work and to the crucial role she has played in building European banking supervision. https://t.co/8f7kDY11w2
Missed Ms Nouy’s interview for the Supervision Newsletter? It’s available in all European languages here https://t.co/wqnN6SX04I https://t.co/P6TLcz0sDM
Ms Nouy speaks about the main achievements of European banking supervision and what she thinks can be further improved. https://t.co/0EPrepqzos

“I have the reputation of being pretty tough, but I still think I’m fair.” Here Danièle Nouy shares with us what she found most interesting during her five years as Supervisory Board Chair. https://t.co/zDvi4Shghc
Today marks the end of Danièle Nouy’s five-year term as Supervisory Board Chair. Recently, she reflected on her time as head of ECB Banking Supervision. https://t.co/gDKKaDfXuw

DECEMBER: one market with one money. With the euro turning 20 soon, President Mario Draghi looks back at the creation of the Single Market and its benefits in a speech @SantAnnaPisa in Italy. Read the full thread https://t.co/IGe15TTAMx https://t.co/I2YyuuzAWd

NOVEMBER: waiting days for your bank transfers to arrive could become a thing of the past! We launched TIPS, a brand new service your bank can use to make your electronic payments immediately, around the clock, anywhere in Europe https://t.co/FNspR6V0vc https://t.co/qIuGFkHRvc

OCTOBER: have you ever thought that hackers could actually be the good guys? In a @TEDx talk at the University of Mannheim, our cyber resilience expert Emran Islam explained how #EthicalHacking helps against cyberattacks. Watch his talk https://t.co/JovCndkHcb https://t.co/hhK7zfmyjy

SEPTEMBER: we revealed our new €100 and €200 #banknotes. With brighter colours, a fresh design and enhanced security features, the new banknotes from the Europa series will be available from 28 May 2019 https://t.co/8gxwMDFyIV https://t.co/yLJqAHjrus

AUGUST: united in diversity. On the occasion of the #EuropeanCulturalDays open air concert, Lithuanian musicians gathered in front of the ECB. Together we celebrated the 100th anniversary of the country’s independence. https://t.co/3Ni9PoUwIi

JULY: research confirms that the ECB’s policy measures have lowered inequality in the eurozone. Watch our explainer on how our monetary policy has reduced inequality or read the full paper https://t.co/0Z6YppWp04 https://t.co/cPqoGe7FyF

JUNE: our anniversary! We celebrated 20 years of working to keep prices stable for the 340 million people who share the euro as their currency. Check out our explainer on the ECB’s tasks to find out more about how our policies affect people’s daily lives https://t.co/KYxBWfiQyd https://t.co/86RNIvftCz

MAY: a new Vice-President for the ECB. With gratitude, we said farewell to Vítor Constâncio, who ended his term as Vice-President of the ECB. We welcomed Luis de Guindos, who took over as Mr Constâncio’s successor. https://t.co/MqCdPrl4Ci

APRIL: one year after we published our guidance on non-performing loans, banks supervised by the ECB had cut their non-performing loans by one fifth. The guidance spells out how fast we expect banks to get rid of, or provision for, loans that turn sour https://t.co/uY0H71tRoc https://t.co/OUvUWkBeEj
MARCH … was enlightening! At the #Luminale2018 festival of light in Frankfurt, our main building transformed into a colourful #crosshatch light show. https://t.co/1g0TRINnrp

FEBRUARY: the discussion continued. Chief Economist Peter Praet answered questions in a live Twitter Q&A. You asked about central banking and beyond, with topics ranging from economic development to how he pronounces his last name (the “e” is silent) https://t.co/zVSUQ7PuTM https://t.co/xFSo3DTwbB

JANUARY: question time! We received more than 280 questions under the hashtag #AskDraghi, on cryptocurrencies, Europe’s economic recovery and the likelihood of another global crisis. Watch President Draghi’s response on bitcoin. https://t.co/tgr5LyH6fN
